project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When setting up JIRA Agile, it is quite common to create test sprints. 

If we delete the test issues that were created, the sprint is still displayed in the report mode, and selecting them a popup says "No issues present in sprint to generate scope change model"

It would be really useful if those sprints were not displayed in the report mode of the boards.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to not view Sprints with no issues in the Agile reports

fields.description:
At the moment, when editing the Burndown gadget, users are only able to choose the current active sprint or the *Next sprint due (auto)*.

At times, it would be useful to have the ability to select previously completed sprints as well.
fields.summary: Previous completed sprint for Burndown Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Verified in a clean JIRA v6.3.10 with JIRA Agile v6.6.13.

*Description*

An Agile board configured with {{assignee in membersOf(GroupName) ORDER BY Rank ASC}} allows a user with no permissions on the projects included in the filter to manipulate sprints.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create two users, two Agile boards/projects (with at least one issue), and one group
# Add User1 to the group
# Assign all issues from all projects to User1
# Assign User2 'jira-users' permission and full project roles on one project only
# Configure Agile board with query {{assignee in membersOf(GroupName) ORDER BY Rank ASC}}
# Start/Complete Sprint with User2

*Expected*

User2 will be unable to manipulate Sprints, given that the Agile board filter includes issues from projects for which User2 has no project roles (no permissions).
fields.summary: membersOf in Agile Board Filter does not Check Permissions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi There,

We are currently looking for a functionality under our sprint report to identify "Completed" issues based on issue types and eventually a sum of total "story points" for that issue type.

eg : 
For "Story" type issues , total story points = 67
For "Bug" type issues, total story points = 39

Thanks
fields.summary: Group issues based on issue types in Sprint Report and calculate story points.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have some scrum boards
# Have a board with sprints numbered (e.g. Sprint 1, Sprint 2)
# Create another board and create a sprint

*Expected Results:*
# Sprint name would come as 'Sprint 1'

*Actual Results:*
# Sprint name is coming as an increment of the last sprint created (e.g. Sprint 3)

*Workaround:*
Use the option to rename sprints (available when clicking on the sprint name on plan or work mode on agile board).

*Notes:*
JIRA OD version: 6.4-OD-07-004
JIRA Agile version: v. 6.3.13.1
fields.summary: Inconsistency on suggested sprint's name

fields.description:
Саша, во вложении превью макетов ТМ ХД «Батон», необходимо внести правки и сделать два варианта:
Вариант №1
•	Заменить надпись на этикетке и колпаке «пол батона» на «півбатона»
•	Заменить надпись на этикетке «білый» на «білий»
Вариант №2
•	Заменить надпись на этикетке и колпаке «пол. батона» на «0,5л. батона»
•	Заменить надпись на этикетке «білый» на «білий»
fields.summary: first

fields.description:
I am a customer of JIRA OnDemand.  The screen Admin->System->System info says that this is OnDemand version 6.4-OD-04-006 (build 64001), which I assume is the latest version as of today's date (Sept. 5, 2014, 8:45am Pacific).

I tried to bulk edit issues in my project, but ran into problems:

- Ran a simple search query to get a list of issues  
- Chose Tools -> Bulk Change (6 issues)
- Selected checkboxes for the 2 issues I wanted to change, clicked Next
- Chose Edit issues, clicked Next
- Scrolled down the field edit form to find the "Change Sprint" field
- The text box to the right of the Change sprint label contains an exception message (see first copy and paste below of exception text for details).  It seems kind of weird that the text box itself, meant for inputting a sprint, contains text.
- If I delete the exception text and type in the name of my sprint (simply "sprint 1"), the typeahead doesn't work. 
- If I check the field sprint checkbox and enter the name of the sprint text anyway and click Next, I get a similar exception on the returned page (see second copy and paste below of exception text for details).

I am able to easily reproduce this problem in 2 of my projects.  Note sure if this info matters, but:

- The issues I'm trying to change have multiple sprints listed in their sprint field (they were rolled over from 1 sprint to another, so both were recorded).  
- The issues I'm trying to change are of type "Story"

If you have questions, please feel free to reach out to me.

-Curt

fields.description:
Currently the only way to track progress within Agile/SCRUM via the burndown chart is to base it on either story points or hours.  The best solution for this is to create sub-tasks and assign hours in order to get a better representation of process within a sprint.  The biggest problem with this is maintaining a lot of "extraneous" issues, when really only one (for the user story) is needed.

It would be nice if instead of sub-tasks, an issue could have a checklist-type field that could used as an estimation statistic for sprint progress tracking (perhaps assign hours to each checklist task).  This would allow for only one issue per user story.

Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Add checklist field that can be used for burndown reporting

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a LexoRank balance job is scheduled on a large instance (200k+ issues) it can take a very long period of time to complete and performs slowly. On an instance with two LexoRank fields it is taking more than 12 hours for each field.

h3. Environment

* Intel® Xeon® Processor E5462 x 2 (8 threads)
* 12 gb RAM. 6gb heap allocated.
* SSD for database and JIRA.
* MySQL database, mounted on the same server.
* Linux 3.13.0-39-generic #66-Ubuntu SMP Tue Oct 28 13:30:27 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Instance size:

{noformat}
___ Database Statistics ____________________

     Issues                                        : 965632
     Projects                                      : 910
     Custom Fields                                 : 460
     Workflows                                     : 278
     Users                                         : 7798
     Groups                                        : 314
     Attachments                                   : 462454
     Comments                                      : 155671
{noformat}

Two LexoRank custom fields:

{noformat}
+----------+----------+
| count(*) | FIELD_ID |
+----------+----------+
|   827972 |    15180 |
|   827972 |    15182 |
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Schedule a balance (either POST to the endpoint or through the LexoRank management tools in 6.7.0+).

h3. Expected Results

The balance completes within a suitable time frame.

h3. Actual Results

The balance takes a significant amount of time to complete.

h3. Notes

This can be sped up by increasing the available resources on the server, reducing the load and also verifying an appropriate read / write speed is present on the Lucene directory. It can be tested as per our [Test the Disk Speed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Testing+Disk+Access+Speed]. Also note we *do not* support NFS mounts for Lucene as per JIRA [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms].

h3. Data

There are 6 thread dumps, with associated CPU % information, attached to this issue contained within [^balancing_operations.tar.gz]. It appears that this is a single-threaded operation as only {{lexorank-executor-thread-0}} is present.
fields.summary: LexoRank Balance takes a very long time on larger instances

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11487].
  {panel}

The configuration pages can't be accessed. The big error modal window pops up and you get an "Internal Server Error" 

Here is what I see when I use firebug:
{code}
Got an error response with text that we don't know how to parse: {"status-code":500,"stack-trace":"java.lang.NullPointerException\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.ColumnEditRequest$StatusDetails.from(ColumnEditRequest.java:145)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.ColumnEditHelper.asStatusEntry(ColumnEditHelper.java:330)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.ColumnEditHelper.buildColumnStatusesModel(ColumnEditHelper.java:313)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.ColumnEditHelper.buildColumnEditModel(ColumnEditHelper.java:185)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditHelper.getEditModel(RapidViewEditHelper.java:139)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditResource$7.call(RapidViewEditResource.java:191)\n\tat 
{code}

h4. Cause:

A status label was renamed. In my example, from *To Do* to *TO DO*. When you try to access the board, it sees that *To Do* does not exist, so it attempts to create it again, since it requires it. But unfortunately, since *TO DO* is essentially the same, it fails. This is a problem with case sensitivity. *Note:* I think this only happens if you edit a status that is already there by default to use a different case.

h4. To Replicate

# Go to {{secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa}} View Statuses, edit a default status to be in all caps for the name (e.g. To Do > TO DO)
# *Create Project > Agile Software Development - Scrum*. Proceed through steps to create.
# Attempt to create an issue in new project, *Error: Could not find workflow status for issue [ ]*
# View *Issues Panel* in Overview: {noformat}An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getUrl' in class com.atlassian.jira.projects.legacy.projectpanel.fragment.impl.StatusSummaryFragment$StatusUrlUtil threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at legacy/templates/projectpanels/fragments/issues/statussummary.vm[line 18, column 50] at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284) at ...{noformat}
# Go to *Agile Simplified Workflow Scheme for Project* and try to click *View as text* next to *Agile Simplified Workflow for Project*, and you will get another error, *The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.* You will still be able to go directly to the workflow from the main Administration screen and view as text.

h4. The Workaround

This issue can be fixed with a manual database change. If you're running into it in a Cloud instance, please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/]. Alternatively for server please refer to our [Internal Server Error when accessing Rapid board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Internal+Server+Error+when+accessing+Rapid+board] KB article.
fields.summary: Internal Server Error on Agile Boards

fields.description:
According to the [Ending a Sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Ending+a+Sprint] documentation, you only need *Administer Project* permission for project of the *issues in that particular sprint* to end it
{quote}Why can't I complete a Sprint?
* You don't have the right permissions: You must have the JIRA 'Project Administrator' permission for all project(s) with issues included in the sprint to complete it. If you cannot complete a sprint, check whether your sprint has issues from a project where you are not a project administrator{quote}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create 2 projects (PROA & PROB)
# Assign user1 as project lead for PROA and give Project Lead the *Administer Project* permission for PROA
# Create a Scrum board with these 2 projects (project in ("Project A", "Project B") ORDER BY Rank ASC
# Create a sprint containing only issues from PROA
# Have user1 try to complete the sprint

h4. Expected results
# User1 should be able to complete sprint because he has *Administer Project* permission for PROA

h4. Actual Results
# Unable to complete the sprint with the button disabled
# Tooltip says
{quote}You must have Project Administrator permissions to complete a sprint{quote}
# Then, just give user1 (Single User) the *Administer Projects* permission for PROB and user1 will be able to complete the sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Accessing certain reports in JIRA Agile causes an exception to be thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access a Sprint Report when there are no issues in the sprint history and the board is configured to use Time Tracking.

h3. Expected Results

The board displays as normal.

h3. Actual Results

This exception is thrown:

{noformat}
2014-11-16 09:22:37,955 http-bio-8080-exec-100 ERROR anonymous 562x39015x5 p0625q 10.137.114.5,10.137.115.6 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/scopechangeburndownchart.json [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: clauseValues is empty
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: clauseValues is empty
at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.not(Assertions.java:186)
at com.atlassian.jira.jql.builder.DefaultJqlClauseBuilder.addStringCondition(DefaultJqlClauseBuilder.java:928)
at com.atlassian.jira.jql.builder.DefaultJqlClauseBuilder.issue(DefaultJqlClauseBuilder.java:595)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.timetracking.TimeTrackingHistoryServiceImpl.getTimeTrackingHistory(TimeTrackingHistoryServiceImpl.java:44)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.chart.SprintBurndownModelFactory.getScopeChangeModelDataForSprint(SprintBurndownModelFactory.java:225)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.chart.SprintBurndownModelFactory.getScopeChangeBurndownModel(SprintBurndownModelFactory.java:140)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.chart.SprintBurndownModelFactory.getScopeChangeBurndownModel(SprintBurndownModelFactory.java:129)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.chart.RapidChartResource$3.call(RapidChartResource.java:153)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.chart.RapidChartResource$3.call(RapidChartResource.java:143)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:42)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.createResponse(AbstractResource.java:100)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:81)
at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.chart.RapidChartResource.getScopeChangeBurndownChart(RapidChartResource.java:142)
at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1626.invoke(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
{noformat}

h3. Notes

The code that generates the sprint history does not handle the case where:
* no issues are in the sprint history, AND
* the board is configured to use Time Tracking

h3. Workaround

Disable Time Tracking in the board's Estimation configuration.

(i) If you're seeing this error message attributed to "anonymous" user access, then it is likely because anonymous users are trying to access sprint reports for which they have no visible issues to see. If you can restriction anonymous access, you'll get fewer of these error messages. Please refer to the [JIRA Admin Helper|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Admin+Helper] to verify permission access to projects.
fields.summary: IllegalArgumentException: clauseValues is empty when accessing sprint reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11483].
  {panel}

When a completed issue that is in a current sprint is added to a version, it is displayed on the Release Burndown report.

If a completed issue that is in an already completed sprint is added to a version, it is NOT displayed on the Release Burndown Report.

By taking a look at the documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Release+Burndown), we can see that:
{quote}
Issue completed in a sprint, but only added to the version afterwards:
- The issue will be shown on the report, as if it was always part of the version.

{quote}

It is not clear if completed issues that are added to the version afterwards should always appear on the Release Burndown report, independent of belonging to an already closed sprint or not. Could you please take a look at that and, in case it is the expected behaviour, update the documentation to make it more clear to customers?

h5.To get the issues show on Release Burndown Report:
# *If issues resolved without Fix Version:*
#- Reopen the issues, add a Fix Version and transit the tickets back to Resolved (such as Resolved, Completed, Closed or Done).
# *If issues resolved contains Fix Version:* 
#- Reopen the issues and transit the tickets back to Resolved (such as Resolved, Completed, Closed or Done).

Thanks!
fields.summary: Completed issues added to a version have different behaviour on Release Burndown report

fields.description:
Applying the filter

(labels = Techdoc OR issuetype = Documentation) AND project in ("IP-DECT Platform", "DX Platform (DECT Handsets)", "Legacy DECT Base Stations", Pagers, "Advanced HS Chargers (DC4/CR3)", "WX Platform (WiFi Handsets)", "DH3 & DH4 Successor", "Logger/PDL (Handset Trace Logging)", "TIC/TIA (Handset Test Interface)") AND status != Closed

Resulted in that the filter displayed all tickets but the board left out two seemingly random statuses. 

Trying to set up a new board without the "OR issuetype = Documentation)" part of the filter and the statuses appear on the board, no problem.

I then put "OR issuetype = Documentation) " part back on the filter, hit save and refresh the board. Check Column management that are flagging that the two statuses "are not available in any of the workflows". But they are available on all workflows. 

We got around it by using this filter: 
((labels = Techdoc AND issuetype != Documentation) OR issuetype = Documentation) AND project in("IP-DECT Platform","DX Platform (DECT Handsets)","Legacy DECT Base Stations",Pagers,"Advanced HS Chargers (DC4/CR3)","WX Platform (WiFi Handsets)","DH3 & DH4 Successor","Logger/PDL (Handset Trace Logging)","TIC/TIA (Handset Test Interface)") AND status != Closed ORDER BY cf[13601] AS

fields.description:
Our sprint names follow certain conventions, and this would allow us to query issues them by a sprint prefix/substring. Otherwise, we have to frequently update our searches, or use custom fields, etc.

An example use case:
We divide our teams/product into projects. They also have separate boards and sprints. Occasionally, one team will take a story from another product. We'd like to filter the board like "Project = project1 OR Sprint ~ project1", so the project1 team could see any issues that are on their sprint.
There are other possible approaches, but they involve too much overhead, especially for the less usual case.
fields.summary: Support the LIKE operator for Sprint field

fields.description:
Current release (6.6.21-D20141105T072822), when creating a new _Agile Software Development - SCRUM_ project through project template, it will automatically be assigned to _Simplified Workflow_ instead of Default JIRA workflow. The new changes will create a _new workflow scheme_, _Screen Scheme_ and _Issue Type Screen Scheme_ for that project. 

The previous version (6.6.0-D20140904T040435) associates the default workflow with the default schemes.

Some customers are not aware with the new changes of Jira Agile's project template, and will require to change their internal processes to accustom to that changes. Furthermore, the lack of information on this change results some inconvenience for the customer to rectify the created projects after the release. And especially for OnDemand customers, this should be communicated better for them as there is no possibility of rolling back.

*Suggestion*

It would be great if the old project template is retained so the users can choose which project template they want to use. Or alternatively, a step by step approach to inform them of this change.

*Additional Information*

* Previous Version:
- 6.6.0-D20140904T040435

The scheme that is previously used:

!Project Template - Before.jpg|thumbnail!

* Current Version:
- 6.6.21-D20141105T072822

The scheme for current version:

!Project Template - After.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Retain the old project template whenever there is a new changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11459].
  {panel}

If a Story that has sub-tasks is assigned to another Sprint, JIRA Agile changes Sprint field for the sub-tasks too. However, no event is sent for the sub-tasks in the JIRA event system - neither ISSUE_UPDATED, nor GENERIC_EVENT.

This presents a problem for other plugins like Structure, which listen for the events and react to them. In particular, Structure's synchronizers are not able to maintain correct representation of the Sprints if its filter synchronizer does not check the updated issue.

Reproduction sequence:
1. Create a story in the backlog
2. Create a sub-task for that story
3. Assign story to Sprint 1, observe: sub-task is also assigned to Sprint 1

Expected: internal event is sent for the story and for the sub-task (issueUpdated or issueGenericEvent)
Observed: the event is sent only for the story

The observation can be done by registering an IssueEventListener. You can also use Structure to verify that the event is not sent:

A. Install Structure
B. Open Structure | Manage Structure, click "Settings" for the structure in the "Sync With..." column
C. Install "Filter" synchronizer with a JQL condition {{sprint = "Sprint 1"}}
D. Resync the synchronizer and open the structure to see all issues from Sprint 1
E. Continue with the reproduction sequence 1-3 above.

Observe: only the Story is added to the structure, but not the sub-task
fields.summary: When JIRA Agile updates sub-task's Sprint field, no event is sent inside JIRA

fields.description:
JIRA Agile fails because of the 2000 marker limit for MS SQL Server queries.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
When there is an additional Rank custom field, during upgrade, JIRA Agile will try to delete the ranks for this custom field. If the duplicate rank field has more than 2000 records, then upgrade fails.

h3.Expected Result
Upgrade is completed without any failures.

h3.Workaround
Use [Switching Databases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Switching+Databases] to use a database server (eg. PostgreSQL) that does not have this restriction.

fields.description:
Today I upgraded to JIRA Agile 6.6.11. The agile boards are working fine, but when I opened my dashboard which shows 2 Agile gadgets, the sprint health and the sprint burndown, they both show the following error:

| An internal server error occurred when requesting resource .

This did not occur before the upgrade. Logfile is attached with the complete stacktrace.
fields.summary: Agile sprint health & burndown gadgets do not work after updating to Agile 6.6.11

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The 'Create Issue' option in Agile Plan Mode is gone after the release on November 3rd 2014. 

After the release, a few bugs were found in OnDemand. Some users are facing a bug similar to [this one|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40653], but this one seems to be unrelated.

h4. Workaround

Workaround 1: It's still possible to create issues from JIRA normally.

Workaround 2: Disable the "jira-inline-issue-create-plugin" plugin:

# As a JIRA administrator, visit the add-on manager (Administration area >> Add-ons tab >> Manage add-ons).
# Search for "jira-inline-issue-create-plugin".
# Expand the plugin section.
# Click "Disable".

Side-effect: This will disable the 'Create Issue' widget under each sprint section in Plan Mode. Users can still create issues using other means.
Note that this add-on will be automatically enabled again by Atlassian when the fix is ready. If you have any trouble with the workaround please contact Support.
fields.summary: Create Issue option is missing in Agile Plan Mode after OD Release
